description: From Latin hyacinthinus, from Ancient Greek ὑακίνθινος (huakínthinos), from ὑάκινθος (huákinthos); corresponding to hyacinth +‎ -ine.

adjectives.description: hyacinthine (comparative more hyacinthine, superlative most hyacinthine)

entries.meaning: Of the colour of a hyacinth (either the gem or the flower); reddish-gold (chiefly with reference to hair).
examples: His fair large front and eye sublime declared / Absolute rule; and hyacinthine locks / Round from his parted forelock manly hung / Clustering, but not beneath his shoulders broad:

entries.meaning: Curling like the petals of the hyacinth.
